cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles east of Melbourne, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast parallel to the southeast U.S. coast, then accelerating northeastward, passing just east of the North Carolina Outer Banks and the southern Mid-Atlantic coast before recurving into the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No U.S. landfall expected – closest approach likely just east of Cape Hatteras, NC

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC northward to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: East-central Florida northward through the North Carolina Outer Banks and portions of the mid-Atlantic coastline, including southeastern Virginia offshore waters
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible Monday night into Tuesday with occasional gusts 25–30 kt; sustained tropical-storm-force winds unlikely
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated for the Chesapeake Bay entrance; only minor water level rises possible on ocean-facing beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible late Monday into Tuesday, locally higher in squalls
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning Sunday night and persisting through Tuesday
